reviewsJson.markdown:
## **⭐ GRM Imp Dust**       ( *Overall Grade:* **A** )

||||||
|:---:|:---:|---|:---:|:---|
|**Hardware**|RDA / RTA||**Sweetness**|🔵 🔵 🔵 🔵 ⚪ ⚪ ⚪ |
|**Style**|DTL||**Juiciness**|🔵 🔵 🔵 🔵 ⚪ ⚪ ⚪ |
|**Concentration**|15% to 16.67%||**Mouth Feel**|🔵 🔵 🔵 🔵 🔵 ⚪ ⚪ |
|**Steeped**|1 - 10 days||**Throat Hit**|🔵 🔵 🔵 🔵 ⚪ ⚪ ⚪ |

|||
|:---:|:---|
|**🔺PROS🔺**|Great already of the shake, very interesting with temperature control|
|**🔻CONS🔻**||
|**🔸TAGS🔸**||
|**🔸USES🔸**|: All by Itself :|

----------  

* **TARGET FLAVOR**  
A nice, simple blend of Blackberry and Custard for those that like a Berry Custard flavor.  

* **ACCURACY :**   🔴 🔴 🔴 🔴 🔴   EXACTLY LIKE THE DESCRIPTION  

----------  
**🔹 Flavor Description 🔹**  
Direct off the shake it has a nice strong blackberry on the inhale and a smooth creamy custard on the exhale. This was unexpected for me since I normally require some steep for this flavor profile to be enjoyable for me.
After about 10 days the blackberry starts to mellow in and the custard comes out more with a mild almost creamy pudding-like texture and just the hint of the right eggy undertone.
I like vaping Imp Dust in temperature control, where lower temperatures support the custard more and higher temperatures bring more presence to the blackberry.  

**🔹 Comments 🔹**  
This concentrate is available at Bull City Flavors, Chefs Flavors or directly at Gremberry Farms. Recommended usage is 15%-20% and it settled nice for me at 16.67% (5 ml in a 30 ml mix), where it is fully present and not middle in your face. SessionDrummer, who posts regularly at ELR, tested it at 13% and was very satisfied at that percentage.
reviewsJson.author: Steve-TC
reviewsJson.title: Imp Dust
